documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference in the amendment summary to changes in the Schedule of Activities (Table 1).

documentContentReferences.name: Study Assessments Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference in the amendment summary to Section 8 for details on procedures at US screening sites.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references in Table 3 to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation as a mitigation strategy for potential risks.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: References to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for supporting data on risks and nonclinical data.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Protocol Features Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes adaptive design features.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Table
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 to Table 7 for criteria on when a dose should be decreased or interrupted.

documentContentReferences.name: Exclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.2 regarding blood donation restrictions.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for details on appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Inclusion Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.1 for contraceptive start times.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 and 7.2 to the SoA (Section 1.3, Table 1) for data collection at the time of study intervention or participant discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding pregnancy as a reason for discontinuation from study intervention.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on detecting, recording, following up, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of lost to follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetics Section Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7 to clarify that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: References from Sections 8.5 and 8.8 to Section 8.1.1 for details on copper and molybdenum measurements.

documentContentReferences.name: Pharmacodynamics Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 to Section 8.6 for details on PD biomarkers.

documentContentReferences.name: Populations for Analysis Table
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets for analysis.

documentContentReferences.name: Study Schematic Figure
documentContentReferences.description: Listing of Figure 1 in the List of Figures.

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, the US Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) regulation at 21 CFR part 312.30(b), and any applicable local regulations.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version. Clarifies study procedures in the US to facilitate recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.
